byline.original: By SARAH MASLIN NIR and LIAM STACK

abstract: Explosion and fire in East Village that injured at least 19 people served as call to action for bystanders who could help; one man climbed last rungs of fire escape to help woman down.
lead_paragraph: The explosion and fire served as a call to action for those who could help, including one man who knocked on windows and called for people to evacuate, and pedestrians who tended to the wounds of the injured.

headline.main: After East Village Blast, a Familiar Sight: New Yorkers to the Rescue
headline.print_headline: After East Village Blast, a Familiar Sight: New Yorkers to the Rescue

snippet: The explosion and fire served as a call to action for those who could help, including one man who knocked on windows and called for people to evacuate, and pedestrians who tended to the wounds of the injured.
